byline.original: By KATE TAYLOR and ELIZABETH A. HARRIS

abstract: New York State Education Dept releases sample questions from third- through eighth-grade state exams, offering parents insight into type of material their children must be familiar with; sample includes wide range in difficulty; exams are some of hardest in country, and only 31 percent of students passed state's reading tests and 36 percent passed its math tests in 2014.
lead_paragraph: Many questions and answers from this year’s third- through eighth-grade tests were publicly released to show parents the kind of work their children were expected to do.

headline.main: New York State Test Questions Tricky for 3rd Graders, and Maybe Some Adults
headline.print_headline: Test Stumps Third Graders, and Perhaps a Few Adults

snippet: Many questions and answers from this year’s third- through eighth-grade tests were publicly released to show parents the kind of work their children were expected to do.
